personalInfo.name: Ujjwal Pathak
personalInfo.bio: Hello! I am currently a final-year student pursuing a degree in Computer Science at Jaypee University of Information Technology. I have recently relocated to Hyderabad and am enjoying the vibrant tech culture here. I am currently working as a Product Development Intern at Darwinbox. If you have any interesting opportunities, feel free to drop me a message at pathak2002ujjwal@gmail.com or drop a message (click me)
personalInfo.about: Who loves to build stuff for the web.

experience.title: Software Developer Intern
experience.details: I worked extensively on the backend development, automation, and API integration for RecRoid.com. I leveraged Hume AI to analyze AI-based interview recordings across 20+ metrics, improving the candidate assessment process. I developed auto-job-apply bots for over 5 job portals, automating the job application process and saving significant time. These bots were configured to run daily Cron jobs using GitHub Actions and deployed on Cloud Functions and browserless infrastructure. Additionally, I integrated OpenAI for customized job application responses, extracted hidden recruiter details for automating cold emails, and implemented promo code functionality with Razorpay and Stripe payment gateways for discounts and free trials.

experience.title: Full Stack Developer Intern
experience.details: I designed and developed a comprehensive Staff Attendance System that streamlined the attendance tracking process by building RESTful APIs. This automation reduced manual work by more than 50%, improving efficiency and accuracy. To enhance security, I integrated JWT authentication, ensuring secure access and data integrity.

projects.name: Interviewlabs
projects.description: I created a C++ interview platform that enables smooth video calls using WebRTC (simple-peer) and real-time IDE collaboration with Socket.io. The platform runs C++ code securely in the cloud using Docker and child processes.

projects.name: Pintastic
projects.description: I developed a Pinterest-like pin-sharing platform using Firebase for user data and pin storage. I also added Chrome Extension support, allowing users to post pins from other websites, which boosted user engagement by 50%.

openSourceContributions.introduction: The Wiki Education Dashboard is a web application that supports education assignments, edit-a-thons, and other editing projects. It provides data and course management features for groups of editors — instructors, students, and others — who are working on Wikipedia, Wikidata, and other Wikimedia wikis.
openSourceContributions.details:
#5541 - Addressed a bug occurring when users tried to select a time before selecting the date while creating a new course.
#5538 - Converted dashboard icons from font files to SVGs, including testing the method of extracting SVGs.
#5542 - Continued the conversion of icons to SVGs and converted one component to a functional component.
#5562 - Completed the conversion of all remaining icons to SVGs and gained experience with server-side rendering.
#5544 - Added a UI feature providing username selection advice before users are directed to Wikipedia for account creation.
#5583 - Simplified program deletion directly from the campaign and explored backend routing and controllers.
#5638 - Implemented a feature to prompt users about adding instructors and sending reminder emails.
#5714 - Developed a feature to show specific featured campaigns on the explore page based on settings, with feature tests.
#4712 - Moved the training update process to Sidekiq, optimizing resource usage during the /reload_training workflow.

openSourceContributions.introduction: The Oppia Foundation is a nonprofit organization that provides free, online learning resources to help people learn in an effective and enjoyable way
openSourceContributions.details:
#21216 - Added language change option to the embedded exploration player, enabling language switching for Oppia course content.
#21207 - Fixed issue where prerequisite skills were appearing blank in the editor.
#21171 - Changed dropdown to heading in the question editor, improving clarity.
#21331 - Fixed error message about unsaved changes.

testimonials.name: Shivansh Sethi
testimonials.message:
I had the privilege of working with Ujjwal Pathak on my personal portfolio website, shivanshsethi.com, and I’m thoroughly impressed with his professionalism, creativity, and technical skills. Ujjwal translated my vision into a sleek, functional website, aligning the design with my goals.

His communication and collaborative approach were exceptional, delivering a polished product within the timeline. I highly recommend Ujjwal to anyone seeking a skilled web developer with a client-first mindset.

testimonials.name: Shrashti Singhal
testimonials.message:
I had the pleasure of mentoring Ujjwal during his internship at Culinda, where he showcased exceptional skills and eagerness to learn. Ujjwal quickly demonstrated proficiency in Node.js and expanded his expertise by working with FastAPI, designing robust databases, and writing Supabase edge functions.

His contributions to a critical module were instrumental, highlighting his technical acumen and problem-solving abilities. I highly recommend Ujjwal for any backend developer role with a focus on Node.js and a strong aptitude for learning and innovation.
